intro: Bidens gracilior, commonly known as slender beggar's ticks, is an annual flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant features slender, hairy stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers consist of yellow disk flowers surrounded by pale yellow to white ray florets. Bidens gracilior is often found in disturbed soils and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
